prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation or translation. Create the first face of the sketch by drawing a line from (0,0) to (0.75, 0). Draw a line from (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.75). Draw a line from (0.75, 0.75) to (0, 0.75). Close the loop by connecting the last point (0, 0.75) back to the first point (0, 0). This results in a single loop with four line segments. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled sketch by a depth of 0.0375 units towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The resulting prism has the following dimensions: length = 0.75, width = 0.75, height = 0.0375. **Part 2: Simple, white, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Set the new coordinate system with no rotation but with a translation vector (0.0422, 0.0422, 0.0375). Create the first face of the sketch by drawing a line from (0,0) to (0.6656, 0). Draw a line from (0.6656, 0) to (0.6656, 0.6656). Draw a line from (0.6656, 0.6656) to (0, 0.6656). Close the loop by connecting the last point (0, 0.6656) back to the first point (0, 0). This loop is identical to that of Part 1 with a different scale factor. Create the second loop by drawing a line from (0.0047, 0.0047) to (0.6609, 0.0047). Draw a line from (0.6609, 0.0047) to (0.6609, 0.6609). Draw a line from (0.6609, 0.6609) to (0.0047, 0.6609). Close the loop by connecting (0.0047, 0.6609) back to (0.0047, 0.0047), creating a smaller square within the previous one. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6656. Set the extrusion parameters with no depth towards the normal and 0.0019 extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. This part is a rectangular prism with inner cutout of a smaller square, with dimensions: length = 0.6656, width = 0.6656, height = 0.0019. **Part 3: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Set the new coordinate system with no rotation but with a translation vector (0.0703, 0.0703, 0.0375). Create the first face of the sketch by drawing a line from (0,0) to (0.6094, 0). Draw a line from (0.6094, 0) to (0.6094, 0.6094). Draw a line from (0.6094, 0.6094) to (0, 0.6094). Close the loop by connecting the last point (0, 0.6094) back to the first point (0, 0). This results in a single loop with four line segments. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6094. Extrude the scaled sketch by a depth of 0 in the normal direction and 0.0023 in the opposite direction. This part is a slightly modified version of the first part, since an extrusion is done in the opposite direction of its normal, with dimensions: length = 0.6094, width = 0.6094, height = 0.0023.</description>
